Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different land habitats (e.g., playground, garden, forest, parking lot) and water habitats (e.g., pond, stream, lake).
The student can illustrate a variety of living things in each land habitat (e.g., trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants).
The student can illustrate a variety of living things in each water habitat (e.g., fish, clams).
The student can show patterns by comparing different types of living things in various habitats through their drawings.
The student can organize and label the plants and animals in their drawings to clearly present their observations.
